column4: hiii. does rc.local execute commands in root mode by default or you need to put a sudo prefix to them?
i am not sure if i should prefix sudo inside rc.local
let me repeat is sudo required when putting commands in rc.local file?
/etc/rc.local
no
it runs in root mode you sure? thats what i needed
who else would it run as, nobody else is logged in
nice ;)
do you know what command should i give to restart networking after i configure an interface in ifconfig
ifconfig eth1 up doesnt seem to work
other than ifconfig up?
i need to go to wireless networking gui and type the gateway address again and subnet then press ok. otherwise i cannot ping. it says no network or something
i'm not sure i spend to much time fighting network manager to get it to stop touching my config. maybe configure dhclient to start on the interface?
i need static address. it is set to use static
route?
it works but after changing the mac address ifconfig eth1 up doesnt seem to work unless i give the gateway again manually in the gui
is there any networking. restart or something. i am new to linux. heard someone say there is something like that
im going to guess you need to mess with route
it is already set through the gui before. let me check resolve.conf then :)
you probably want to disable network manager handling the device
that would be better
do you know any way to bring the vnc server (remote desktop) back in ubuntu? i am unable to connect to the server anymore. i can just ping to the machine running ubuntu
can you ssh in
how? does ubuntu have a ssh server by default?
